title: How can we conquer our emotions to progress and achieve our objectives?
first_phrase: In the earlier section of this text, the author focused on the impact of emotion on our mental side, emphasizing the need for self-mastery and limiting emotional responses to external agitations. In the last part, the author delves deeper into the role of emotion in hindering progress and focuses on anxieties and worries. The text highlights the need to immediately forget the small nuisances of life and avoid being influenced by emotional excitements. The author also emphasizes the importance of being a confident master in one's game and remaining objective to build in reality.
content: You must learn to react externally only to a limited extent whenever you are plunged inside the small inevitable agitations which daily life imposes: Move slowly, breathe deeply, and think that your legs have become heavy. If on some occasions feigning anger might prove to be beneficial for the attainment of your objective, being truly angry is always harmful. In his inward, the experienced man is hard to be influenced. He might be able to show himself convinced, to great effect even when he is not. That is even more pronounced if we pay heed to the way in which those who are truly sure of themselves behave. Such a quality helps one become a good actor, one who is a confident master in his own game. You should learn the art of immediately forgetting the small nuisances, the negligible forms of opposition which are a necessary part of lifeâ€™s infinite harmony, and without which life would be felt to be tasteless as a result of showing an excessively beautiful aspect of its self. Preoccupation All these emotional excitements are part of the more general phenomenon of anxieties and worries.
last_phrase: In conclusion, to cultivate inner peace and resilience in the face of life's daily agitations, it is crucial to develop a measured response, channeling thoughts and behaviors in a positive direction. This involves breathing deeply, moving with intention, controlling emotions, and eliminating worry. By learning to separate trivial nuisances from larger concerns, you can live a more abundantly joyful and fulfilling life.
